skillTree.localised_description: An extremely light yet resilient material, Ithilmar gives the same protection as heavy steel, but without slowing down its wearer.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: Ulthuan's Great Eagles are the firm allies of the Elves, fighting their causes since the coming of Chaos.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

skillTree.localised_description: Excellent Elven chariots, barded with priceless Ithilmar for extra protection on the battlefield but at no cost in speed or agility.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

skillTree.localised_description: The High Elves possess a natural skill that far outstrips the prowess of ordinary mortals.
The Trickster God knows all manner of ploys and ruses that can be used to counter missile attacks.
Knowledge can be used as a shield against magical attack.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: When normally killed in action, this Hero will be wounded instead

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Heroes of the same type

skillTree.localised_description: This one is well-versed in the various court intrigues of the Asur, which is something of an advantage in matters of diplomacy.
"The Realms of Man must not fall. Our fate is intertwined with theirs, and if they fall, so too do we."

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +2 with Southern Realms and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Of all the 'younger races', the ultra-secretive Lizardmen respect the Asur the most - enough to grant access to certain high-caste individuals.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
Panic and fear are things that happen to others.

effects.description: Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Dark Elves
Weapon strength: +15% when fighting against Greenskins, Skaven, Dark Elves, Beastmen, Warriors of Chaos, Daemons of Chaos and Norsca

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
What the enemy cannot see, it cannot hit. What the enemy cannot see, it cannot survive.
The war is endless. The cycle of charging, clashing, and bloody hand-to-hand fighting is without end. It will never stop.
Those in the army can find succour or be replenished by the power of this champion.

effects.description: Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 3%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 6%
Replenish Troops action: Replenishment rate is increased by an additional 9%

skillTree.localised_description: Trade and investment are the pillars of development.

effects.description: Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +6%
Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +16%
Increase Trade action: Tradable resource production increased by an additional +30%

skillTree.localised_description: Wealthy are they who can convince others of their ways without resort to pressure or cajolery.

effects.description: Secure Influence action: Influence is increased by an additional 1
Secure Influence action: Influence is increased by an additional 2
Secure Influence action: Influence is increased by an additional 3

skillTree.localised_description: A skilled assassin is a cold-hearted killer and merciless murderer.
Lying in wait, experienced and patient, striking when the foe least expects.

effects.description: Assault Units action: Additional 3% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 8% casualties inflicted
Assault Units action: Additional 15% casualties inflicted

skillTree.localised_description: An expert in their craft, this Hero knows all the mistakes that can be made and how to best avoid making them.

attributes.bullet_text: When bracing, this unit negates the charge bonus of any large attacker.
When bracing, this unit deals additional damage when attacking charging enemies.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Hmmm interesting. I do wonder if there's a third way, however…"
"Come now, let this conflict cease. We're all Asur, remember?"
This one smooths the way, so differing opinions do not so easily lead to frayed tempers and drawn blades.
Extravagant and dissolute, this one could almost be an honorary Druchii, such is their inclination for excess.
This one acts not for themselves but the for the greater good, in defence of the future.
The best way to hang on to your gold is never to spend any of it.
"I'm sorry, what? I was looking at that cloud - looks just like Aenarion in a certain light."
The Daemon is very definitely in the detail…
Whatever the task, this one always wishes to do it to the best of their ability - and better on every occasion thereafter.

effects.description:
[HIDDEN - do not translate] Used to increase lord rank when replacing a lord (target the effect at forces factionwide) - use in conjunction with a shown effect that targets provinces factionwide
	(all armies)
Diplomatic relations: +5 with Humans and High Elves

backgroundSkills.localised_description: It's as much effort as this one can make to lift a blade, let alone swing it at an opponent with force.
Every action is executed seemingly without effort.
You really don't want to be on the receiving end of an attack made by this one. You really don’t.
Some warriors are like rocks - hard and immovable. This one is like jelly…
This one moves like lightning, ducking and twisting to avoid their opponent's blows.
Armour is just a formality when you're as hard as nails and as tough as old boots.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Entities with this attribute ignore the effects of enemy contact effects such as  Poison

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Bones are not supposed to be on the outside.
The very picture of good health. Clearly, there's many years still ahead of them.
This one is not at all easy to kill, and many have tried, believe me.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Even when performing the most fatiguing actions, this unit never loses vigour.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If there's a right way to do something, this one doesn't have the wherewithal to know what it is.

effects.description:
Melee attack: -3 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: -3 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Hero's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Practice really does make perfect, or at least makes it much harder to kill.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +3 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Hero's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Skills refined and improved upon over time can only increase one's edge over the foe.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers and Silver Helms units
	(Hero's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Shadow Warriors, Shadow-walkers and Silver Helms units
	(Hero's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Spearmen, Silverin Guard, Rangers, Archers and Lothern Sea Guard units
	(Hero's army)

Unit experience gain: +25% for Phoenix Guard
	(Hero's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: This one doesn't have the stomach for intrigue, let alone war and its privations.
There's nothing quite so impressive - and painful - as a well-timed, well-ordered charge.
On occasion, throwing the whole nine leagues at the enemy is just the ticket.
Some things should not have to be endured.
Self-starting is a useful ability; starting others - and keeping them that way - more useful still.
This one is a driving force; potential is taken and transformed into decisive action by their hand.
